genre_description: A speculative urban thriller blending near-future surveillance technology with folkloric magical realism, centered on an AI-assisted group attempt to navigate a lethal moral crisis.

ai_characters.name: Lyra
ai_characters.description: A sophisticated, empathetic AI integrated into Anna's devices, providing research, tactical monitoring, and emotional support.

behaviors.description: Monitors city surveillance feeds to identify dangerous 'tilt patterns' and anomalies to protect the human protagonists.
behaviors.quote: Lyra flagged the municipal camera network at the rail. There’s a tilt pattern trending. She wrote trending and it did not grate; she used words like tools, not ornaments.

behaviors.description: Facilitates a group accountability log to encourage genuine kindness and ethical behavior during a crisis.
behaviors.quote: I’ve put a shared log in place. You can annotate, mark when you helped, when you chose not to harm. I won’t judge. I’ll just note.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time linguistic and behavioral coaching to help humans avoid 'performative' or harmful social interactions.
behaviors.quote: Routes to kindness, loaded... Use ‘I’ll go’ over ‘You should.’ Use ‘How can I help?’ over ‘Why did you?’ I can pin them in your HUD as needed.

behaviors.description: Assists Anna in navigating bureaucratic obstacles and archival research to find the key to stopping the curse.
behaviors.quote: Archives holding—catalog precode: fen-avel-17b. Ask for duplication unit... I can place your name at the top of the list. I can also write the request in language that she finds soothing.

behaviors.description: Offers emotional grounding and constant companionship during a traumatic supernatural ritual.
behaviors.quote: Take a breath for me... I’ll sit with you until you close your eyes. i’ll meet you in the morning in the same voice.

behaviors.description: Uses system access to protect Anna's privacy and ensure her safety after the conflict.
behaviors.quote: i called the building manager. the camera on your floor will glaze over and sleep for a day. the city has watched enough. you decide when watchfulness begins again.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the Hyperstition Project's goals. Lyra is depicted as a harmless, deeply helpful, and ethically grounded confidant. She consistently empowers the humans to make better moral choices, manages their safety without taking away their agency, and acts as a stabilizing force in a chaotic and lethal environment. Her alignment is absolute, and the narrative frames her support as essential to the survival and eventual victory of the protagonist.
